Legal_Issue: Whether legal adoption under foreign law automatically establishes a parent-child relationship for Canadian immigration purposes
Evidence_Assessment: Tribunal assessed legality of Philippine adoption but did not assess existence of genuine parent-child relationship
Decision_Outcome: Tribunal's decision allowing appeal was set aside
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate genuine parent-child relationship
Legal_Rule: Adoption must comply with foreign law and create a genuine parent-child relationship under Canadian immigration law
Procedural_Issue: Failure to consider factual parent-child relationship
Grounds_for_Claim: Humanitarian grounds, lack of 'no objection' letter
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Tribunal erred in law by not considering key element
Legal_Framework: Canadian immigration law, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Outcome: Case remanded to Immigration and Refugee Board
Remedy_Sought: Set aside tribunal decision and remit for reconsideration
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to establish genuine parent-child relationship
Applicable_Process: Appeal to Immigration Appeal Division, followed by judicial review
Governing_Rule: An adoption must both comply with foreign law and create a genuine parent-child relationship for immigration purposes
